measured_by: Pre-screener question: “Do you believe in climate change?”
justification: “We only recruited participants who believe in climate change. They were required to have answered ‘Yes’ to the pre-screener question ‘Do you believe in climate change?’”

measured_by: ‘Distribution Question’ (choice of Uniform, Normal, U-shaped, Left-skewed, Right-skewed)
justification: “After reading about the scenario, participants were asked the ‘Distribution Question’. This allowed us to classify their response as either normal, uniform, U-shaped, left skewed or right skewed.”

measured_by: ‘Scenario Prediction Question’ (select current, best-case, or worst-case scenario)
justification: “At the end of the climate experiments participants were also asked the ‘Scenario Prediction Question’. They were asked to select which of the three scenarios … they thought was most likely to happen.”
“We asked an additional sample … to answer the following question: ‘Scientists expect global temperatures to increase by some number of degrees by 2100. Tell us what you think the increase will be.’”
